summary: Purpose of the Act is to alter the rates of the standard allowance, limited capability for work element and limited capability for work and work-related activity element of universal credit and the rates of income-related employment and support allowance.
Key definitions include the standard allowance, LCWRA element, LCW element, pre-2026 claimant, severe conditions criteria claimant, and ESA IR personal allowance.
Eligibility criteria include having limited capability for work and work-related activity, being a pre-2026 claimant, being a severe conditions criteria claimant, or being terminally ill.

Obligations include the Secretary of State/Department for Communities in Northern Ireland exercising relevant powers to secure minimum amounts for the standard allowance, LCWRA element, and ESA IR personal allowance.
Enforcement elements include provisions for penalties and record-keeping requirements.

sections.definitions: Sections 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and Schedule 1 and 2 define key terms such as the standard allowance, LCWRA element, LCW element, pre-2026 claimant, severe conditions criteria claimant, and ESA IR personal allowance.
sections.obligations: Sections 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 require the Secretary of State/Department for Communities in Northern Ireland to exercise relevant powers to secure minimum amounts for the standard allowance, LCWRA element, and ESA IR personal allowance.
sections.responsibilities: Sections 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 outline the responsibilities of the Secretary of State/Department for Communities in Northern Ireland to set minimum amounts and uprate benefits.
sections.eligibility: Sections 2, 3, 4, and Schedule 1 and 2 specify the eligibility criteria of being a pre-2026 claimant, severe conditions criteria claimant, or terminally ill.
sections.payments: Sections 1, 4, and 5 outline the payment calculation and entitlement structure for the standard allowance, LCWRA element, and ESA IR personal allowance.
sections.penalties: There are no explicit penalty provisions in the Act.
sections.record_keeping: There are no explicit record-keeping or reporting requirements in the Act.
